ref_item.label: Healer HIV testing intervention
ref_item.description: We will follow Ugandan National protocols to administer voluntary HIV testing at 9 TH practice locations throughout Mbarara District over a 9 month period.
interventionNames: Behavioral: HIV testing at traditional healer practices

pred_item.label: Intervention Group
pred_item.description: Traditional healers provided counselling and offered point-of-care HIV tests to adult clients.

ref_item.label: Healer control arm
ref_item.description: Patients will undergo protcolized usual TH care at 8 practices, which include HIV education and a referral to receive VCT through existing resources. Study staff will contact the client at 3 months following enrollment to assess for self-report of VCT.

pred_item.label: Control Group
pred_item.description: Traditional healers provided referral for HIV testing at nearby clinics (usual care).

ref_item.name: HIV testing at traditional healer practices
ref_item.description: HIV 1/2 antigen-antibody POC test (OraquickÂ©) will be administered to those participants who agree to test. Pre-test counseling will be performed before results are delivered. Clients with positive tests will be provided with detailed contact information for the MUST ISS clinic, and given specific instructions to present to the clinic as soon as possible for confirmatory testing and linkage to care.

pred_item.name: Healer-delivered point-of-care HIV testing
pred_item.description: Healers received training on pre-test and post-HIV test counselling and administration of Oraquick HIV testing kits. They provided counselling and offered point-of-care HIV tests (Oraquick) directly to adult clients.

ref_item.measure: Number of TH Clients Who Received HIV Testing
ref_item.description: Primary study outcome was receipt of an HIV test within 90 days of enrollment. In the control arm, this was assessed via self-report at time of 90-day phone call follow up. For intervention arm, the participating healer recorded whether an HIV test was accepted by the participant at the time of the study visit. If the HIV test was accepted and delivered, the healer recorded the result of the test.

pred_item.measure: Individual receipt of an HIV test
pred_item.description: In the control group, the outcome was assessed via self-report at the time of the 90-day follow-up phone call. For the intervention group, the participating healer recorded whether an HIV test was accepted by the client at the time of the study visit. If accepted and delivered, the result was recorded.

ref_item.measure: Number of New HIV Diagnoses Among TH Clients
ref_item.description: For intervention arm participants, the healer recorded the result of the point-of-care HIV test for those participants who agreed to test during the study visit. In the control arm, this outcomes was assessed via self-report during the 90-day follow up phone call.

pred_item.description: Assessed via self-report during the 90-day follow-up phone call.

ref_item.measure: Number of Patients With +HIV Test Who Successfully Link to HIV Care
ref_item.description: This outcome was assessed via self-report during the 90-day follow up phone call. For participants newly testing HIV-positive, questions were posed to determine if they had received confirmatory testing, and initiated ART medication.

pred_item.description: Assessed for clients who were newly diagnosed. Prespecified questions were posed via self-report to determine whether clients had received confirmatory testing and initiated antiretroviral therapy (ART).

ref_item.measure: Age in Years of Control Arm Subjects Who Received an HIV Test
ref_item.description: Participants in the control arm assessed for primary outcomes of receiving an HIV test within 3 months of study enrollment. Participant age in years at time of study enrollment, and association with primary outcome of receiving an HIV test

ref_item.measure: Gender of Control Arm Subjects Who Received an HIV Test
ref_item.description: Self-reported participant gender and association with primary study outcome of receiving an HIV test

pred_item.description: Recorded and defined on the basis of prespecified criteria.

ref_item.measure: Highest Level of Education for Control Arm Subjects Who Received an HIV Test
ref_item.description: Participant self-reported highest level of education, and association with study primary outcome of receiving an HIV test
